title: Wrong surface water test COD instead of TOC
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "1df382a0-1116-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Monitoring Returns", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=1df382a0-1116-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Wrong surface water test COD instead of TOC", "description": "We recently encountered an issue regarding the testing of surface water (SW1) for Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD) instead of Total Organic Carbon (TOC) as required by our new IED licence P0091-03. This discrepancy was identified when an out-of-spec COD sample on SW1 prevented us from reporting the COD result on the EPA Eden web portal.
Upon reviewing the test requirements, it was discovered that the COD testing had not been updated to TOC testing as per the new licence requirements. The new IED licence P0091-03 mandates weekly TOC testing with a limit of 150 mg/L. However, the QC lab continued to test for COD due to an oversight that occurred during a change in QC Lab management in 2023. The previous QC Lab manager left, and there was a period of time until a new lab manager started in mid-2024, during which the changeover to TOC testing did not happen.
To rectify this issue, the QC team has reviewed the P0091-03 licence requirements and contacted Eurofins to request the correct TOC test to be conducted on SW1. It is important to note that TOC testing was already being completed weekly on SW1A and SW1B, which feed into SW1 at the outfall.
Regarding the identified COD out-of-spec result on 21/03/2025, the SW1 surface water was diverted to the effluent until the following COD result came back into the normal range. No abnormal operations or issues were identified that caused the high COD. The COD samples that were taken for SW1 were still treated as per the previous licence requirement P0091-02.
We apologize for any non-conformance with our licence and assure you that steps have been taken to ensure compliance with the new licence requirements moving forward.
Results from 2024 for SW1 COD using the typical relationship between COD and TOC and found them to be less than the TOC limit of 150 mg/L based on the typical relationship. see attached PDF with COD results 2024.", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "1df382a0-1116-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Monitoring Returns", "reference": "LR093348", "subject": "Monitoring Returns:Water", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "2dfc6df2-86ad-474c-820d-7bbf93afb956", "licenceprofileid": "c1238cbc-2056-4df5-8942-ad1706e3b7cf", "datereceived": "2025-04-10T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-06-09T00:00:00", "title": "Wrong surface water test COD instead of TOC", "doctype": "Monitoring Returns", "docsubtype": "Water", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "We recently encountered an issue regarding the testing of surface water (SW1) for Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD) instead of Total Organic Carbon (TOC) as required by our new IED licence P0091-03. This discrepancy was identified when an out-of-spec COD sample on SW1 prevented us from reporting the COD result on the EPA Eden web portal.\r\nUpon reviewing the test requirements, it was discovered that the COD testing had not been updated to TOC testing as per the new licence requirements. The new IED licence P0091-03 mandates weekly TOC testing with a limit of 150 mg/L. However, the QC lab continued to test for COD due to an oversight that occurred during a change in QC Lab management in 2023. The previous QC Lab manager left, and there was a period of time until a new lab manager started in mid-2024, during which the changeover to TOC testing did not happen.\r\nTo rectify this issue, the QC team has reviewed the P0091-03 licence requirements and contacted Eurofins to request the correct TOC test to be conducted on SW1. It is important to note that TOC testing was already being completed weekly on SW1A and SW1B, which feed into SW1 at the outfall.\r\nRegarding the identified COD out-of-spec result on 21/03/2025, the SW1 surface water was diverted to the effluent until the following COD result came back into the normal range. No abnormal operations or issues were identified that caused the high COD. The COD samples that were taken for SW1 were still treated as per the previous licence requirement P0091-02.\r\nWe apologize for any non-conformance with our licence and assure you that steps have been taken to ensure compliance with the new licence requirements moving forward.\r\nResults from 2024 for SW1 COD using the typical relationship between COD and TOC and found them to be less than the TOC limit of 150 mg/L based on the typical relationship. see attached PDF with COD results 2024.", "documentcategory": "Non-Compliant", "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Update on WwTP
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "b6a457f8-d62d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=b6a457f8-d62d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Update on WwTP ", "description": "Aurivo wish to provide the EPA with an update of the plans for the upgrade of the WwTP in 2025 and onwards.  It has been decided to install the New Balance Tank and 3 MBR's in 2025 subject to planning permission due on the 25th June 2025.  The works on the replacement of the DAF are ongoing and is planned to completed commissioning in June 2025.  In 2026 the Balance & Calamity Tanks will be constructed. 
The plan design is for 450 m3/day and the 3 MBR's will give a flow of 375 m3/day and a fourth MBR will increase the capacity to 450 m3/day if the site need the additional capacity. 
Attached is a revised Commissioning Plan, revised project schedule, revised WwTP design Report and Presentation on the upgrade of the WwTP.

If you require any further information please do not hesitate to contact me.

Regards
Trevor Montgomery 
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "b6a457f8-d62d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094345", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "9acf18f7-67d8-e811-a2db-0050568a66b2", "licenceprofileid": "bd27580f-5fd8-e811-a2db-0050568a66b2", "datereceived": "2025-05-10T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-20T00:00:00", "title": "Update on WwTP ", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Aurivo wish to provide the EPA with an update of the plans for the upgrade of the WwTP in 2025 and onwards.  It has been decided to install the New Balance Tank and 3 MBR's in 2025 subject to planning permission due on the 25th June 2025.  The works on the replacement of the DAF are ongoing and is planned to completed commissioning in June 2025.  In 2026 the Balance & Calamity Tanks will be constructed. \r\nThe plan design is for 450 m3/day and the 3 MBR's will give a flow of 375 m3/day and a fourth MBR will increase the capacity to 450 m3/day if the site need the additional capacity. \r\nAttached is a revised Commissioning Plan, revised project schedule, revised WwTP design Report and Presentation on the upgrade of the WwTP.\r\n\r\nIf you require any further information please do not hesitate to contact me.\r\n\r\nRegards\r\nTrevor Montgomery \r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: Follow-up on the temporary change of primary FID
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "f31f7682-9c2d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=f31f7682-9c2d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "Follow-up on the temporary change of primary FID", "description": "Dear Ms. Kelly,

Following the previously submitted return (LR094301) on the 08/05/2025, the SK FID has resumed its role as the primary FID as of today (10/05/2025) following maintenance. 

Kind regards,
Katie Casserley 10/05/2025 13:44pm
", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{"licenseereturnid": "f31f7682-9c2d-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "type": "Site Updates/Notifications", "reference": "LR094344", "subject": "Site Updates/Notifications:Other", "status": "Closed", "licenceid": "579f95d7-7244-e711-91cb-0050568a69e2", "licenceprofileid": "b72ba093-7044-e711-91cb-0050568a69e2", "datereceived": "2025-05-10T00:00:00", "closeddate": "2025-05-12T00:00:00", "title": "Follow-up on the temporary change of primary FID", "doctype": "Site Updates/Notifications", "docsubtype": "Other", "decision": "Assessed", "description": "Dear Ms. Kelly,\r\n\r\nFollowing the previously submitted return (LR094301) on the 08/05/2025, the SK FID has resumed its role as the primary FID as of today (10/05/2025) following maintenance. \r\n\r\nKind regards,\r\nKatie Casserley 10/05/2025 13:44pm\r\n", "documentcategory": null, "complianceinvestigationid": null}"}

title: In-Situ Thermal Treatment
document_type: Requests for Approval and Site Reports
metadata_json:
{"compliance_id": "70a4362a-5c20-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "document_type": "Requests for Approval and Site Reports", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/LicenseeReturns/byid?lr_id=70a4362a-5c20-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a", "title": "In-Situ Thermal Treatment", "description": "Dear Inspector,

See attached an SEW in relation to the proposed In-Situ Thermal Treatment (ISTT) proposed for AEC2 at the Roche facility in Clarecastle.

If you have any queries in relation to the attached please let us know.

Kind regards,

On behalf of Roche

{"compliance_id": "cd543b38-b2d3-478e-88f7-b736d0b0222d", "document_type": "Meeting", "document_url": "https://data.epa.ie/leap/api/v1/MeetingCorrespondence/meetingbyid?meeting_id=cd543b38-b2d3-478e-88f7-b736d0b0222d", "title": "", "description": "", "submission_date": "", "status": "Closed", "metadata": "{\"meetingid\": \"cd543b38-b2d3-478e-88f7-b736d0b0222d\", \"type\": \"Meeting\", \"reference\": \"MTG000746\", \"subject\": \"Ringsend WWTP upgrade project update from Uisce \\u00c9ireann\", \"status\": \"Closed\", \"meetingdate\": \"2025-04-07T00:00:00\", \"organisationid\": \"f5545f77-3749-e211-9eb5-0050568a69e2\", \"location\": \"Online MS Teams\", \"regarding\": \"Compliance Investigations\", \"meetingtime\": \"12:00\", \"attendeesepa\": \"Lorcan Farrell, Stephen McCarthy, David Shannon\", \"attendeesnoepa\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann: Ringsend WWTP Upgrade Project Team, Compliance Team & Asset Operations\\n\", \"actionitems\": \"

A video conference meeting was held between the EPA and Uisce Éireann (UÉ) on 08/04/2025 from 12:00 to 12:50 approx.

\\n

During the meeting UÉ gave an update to the EPA on the phased upgrades being undertaken at Ringsend WWTP and a summary of treatment plant performance for Q1 2025.

\\n

Works on Hybrid II upgrades and sludge treatment facilities are progressing as scheduled with all primary aspects of the upgrade project due for completion by end 2025. A programme of ancillary works connected with the overall upgrade project is also being progressed with most completion dates falling within 2025.

\\n

A summary of plant performance was given. UÉ are aiming for 104 compliance samples to be taken during 2025. 10 no. samples records were recorded in the Q1 Update under compliance investigation (CI000025).  Compliance results were unavailable for the first three weeks of January. This was attributed to operational reasons (plant shutdowns) and management changeover. It is UÉ’s intention to make up the shortfall to 104 compliance samples over the year. It was acknowledged that there is a risk that TN and TP average limits may not be achieved this year. UÉ expect that performance will improve across all parameters once remaining upgraded SBR blocks come back on-line and as average air temperatures increase through the year. UÉ confirmed that higher than expected load on the plant (2.17 PE in 2024) was expected to continue increasing in 2025 and is also affecting treatment performance. Issues with the aeration system in the Capital Upgrade treatment block were also cited as a compounding factor in treatment performance and should be resolved by end April 2025.

\\n

The EPA instructed Uisce Éireann to carry out all actions necessary to comply with the waste water discharge licence.

\", \"licenceid\": \"4ab24fc5-2bf8-4aa8-ad9e-f4f68c559186\", \"originalmeetingid\": \"0d83b2ed-7614-f011-a373-0050568a2d1a\", \"organisationname\": \"Uisce \\u00c9ireann\"}"}
